title: How to Make Mixed Mini Muffin Skewers

steps.headline: Sift the dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
Combine the eggs, milk, and oil into the bowl.
Equally divide the mixture into three separate medium bowls.
steps.description: Add and stir in the mashed banana to the first bowl. Add and stir in the chopped strawberries to the second bowl. Add and stir in the chocolate chips and melted chocolate to the third bowl.

steps.headline: Bake the muffins.
steps.description: Always work on one flavor bowl at a time. You can wrap the other two bowls with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator until ready to use. Pour each mixture into pre-greased mini muffin pans. Bake for 16 minutes.

steps.headline: Allow to cool completely on wire racks.
Make the skewers.
steps.description: Just like kabobs, thread and add one flavor muffin from each batch onto a skewer.

text: Preheat the oven to 325ºF/170ºC.  Sift the dry ingredients together in a large bowl.  Combine the eggs, milk, and oil into the bowl.  Equally divide the mixture into three separate medium bowls. Add and stir in the mashed banana to the first bowl. Add and stir in the chopped strawberries to the second bowl. Add and stir in the chocolate chips and melted chocolate to the third bowl. Bake the muffins. Always work on one flavor bowl at a time. You can wrap the other two bowls with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator until ready to use. Pour each mixture into pre-greased mini muffin pans. Bake for 16 minutes. Allow to cool completely on wire racks.  Make the skewers. Just like kabobs, thread and add one flavor muffin from each batch onto a skewer.
